Nope, that's not how it works. You cannot selectively null only one part of a number sequence and call the rest valid. Whatever gets nulled, everything after that up to the revert gets nulled as well. As per rule #6.

The sequence was:

Dman: 46

Fel: 44 (overriding Dman)

Floppster: 42

Dharak: 43

Cheezburgar: 44

Floppster: 43

Ethan: 44

Endersman: 45 (is this the post you are refering to?)

Ethan: 46

Prof. Endwalker: 47

Endersman: 48

Chillin: 47

Ethan: 48

Endersman: 49

Dman: Nulling everything from Floppster (bolded), calling the number 46 valid

Ethan: continuing from 46 with 47

And then it was just rising. Well, until Fel reverted to his 44. Point is, Endersman's 45 was nulled by you even before Fel's revert, it cannot possibly be valid now.

Oh, and the game goes to 42.

I'm so confused...did I do something wrong?

43 I think...

^ nope, everything is as it should be
